title: Engine - Removal

body.body: Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall, causing injury to the operator or damage to the motorcycle.
When using lifting equipment, make sure the minimum safe working load of the lifting equipment exceeds the weight of the motorcycle it is lifting.
Equipment not suitable for lifting the motorcycle's weight may fail during operation.
Lifting equipment not suitable to support the weight of the motorcycle could fail causing personal injury.
If required, drain the engine oil (see
Sump guard removal PR1; PRB; PRC; PS1; PSB; PSC; PWC; PX1; PXB; PXC; PY1; PYB; PYC

metadata.ModelsTaxonomyLink: PWC; PYB; PXB; PSB; PRB; PYC; PXC; PSC; PRC; PY1; PX1; PS1; PR1

body.body: Remove the fixing securing the sump guard front bracket to the lower crankcase.
Release the fixings and remove the sump guard front bracket.

body.name: Sump guard bracket rear fixings B02336

body.body: Release the fixings and remove the starter motor cover. Discard the fixings.
Ease the rubber boot from the starter cable, release the nut and disconnect the cable.
Release the fixings and detach the starter motor cable P-clips from the sump.
Note the orientation of the coolant hose and its clamps for installation.
Release the clamps and detach the coolant outlet hose and the coolant bypass hose from the radiator.
Note the position of the regulator/rectifier cover retaining clips for installation.
Release the retaining clips and remove the cover from the regulator/rectifier.
Release the locking tabs, disconnect both electrical connectors from the regulator/rectifier.
Detach the vent hose from the evaporative cannister.
Release the fixing securing the lower bracket to the radiator duct.
Remove the fixing securing the radiator lower bracket to the frame.
Release the fixing securing the radiator to the lower bracket.
Detach the lower bracket from the evaporative canister and position to one side.
Note the routing of the brake lines and battery negative cable on the right hand side of the seat bridge for installation.
Remove the cable tie and position the main harness to the right hand side of seat bridge.
Reposition the main harness on the right hand side of the seat bridge to access a fixing.
Detach the two brake lines and the battery negative cable from the left hand side of the seat bridge.
Remove and discard the fixings securing the seat bridge to the frame. Collect the washers and remove the bridge.
Disconnect the secondary air injection valve electrical connector.
Remove the foam pad on to the chassis ECM unit bracket.
Release the fixings, detach the engine ground cable and remove the chassis ECM unit bracket.
Before the disconnection of any wiring, note the routing of all wiring and wiring connectors for installation.
Disconnect the following engine subharness connectors:
rotational ON/OFF switch connector (US markets only).
detach the regulator/rectifier harness from the cable guide.
position the engine subharness connector out of the chassis ECM wire guide.
Release the fixings and detach the wire guide from the breather cover. Discard the fixings.
Note that the chassis ECM wire guide is secured to the upper crankcase by two retaining clips and a fixing.
Remove and discard the fixing securing the chassis ECM wire guide to the upper crankcase.
Release the two retaining lugs and detach the wire guide from the crankcase.
Release the locking device and slide the keyless ECM connector forwards to detach it from its bracket.
Disconnect the electrical connectors from the ignition coils.
Release the fixings and remove the ignition coil cover.
Note the position of the split line on the lifter arm to the alignment mark on the lifter shaft for installation.
Release the fixings and detach the clutch slave cylinder bracket from the clutch cover.
Remove and discard the fixing on the clutch lifter arm and slide the clutch lifter arm from the splined clutch lifter shaft.
Remove the left hand outrigger cover (see
Release the fixing and detach the engine ground cable from the crankcase.
Remove and discard the gear change pedal pivot bolt .
Release the fixing and detach the gear change knuckle from the gear change shaft.
Note the routing of the starter motor cable for installation.
Make sure the engine and the motorcycle frame are stabilised and adequately supported. This will help prevent it from falling and causing injury to the operator or damage to the motorcycle.
Note the position and orientation of the gaiter clamps for installation.
Release the clamps securing the drive shaft front gaiter to the front bevel box and the drive shaft cover.
Remove the lock nut and bolt securing the top link to the final drive. Discard the lock nut.
Collect the spacer and detach the top link from the rear bevel box.
Support the rear wheel and remove the bolt and nut securing the top link to the rear wheel hanger.
Collect the spacer and detach the top link from the rear wheel hanger.
Note that there is a master spline when fitting the drive shaft to the front bevel box.
Lower the rear wheel to detach the drive shaft from the front bevel box.
Place support beneath the engine and make sure that the frame is still adequately and securely supported.
Expanding sleeves and tapered adjusters are used on the right hand side of the frame.
The numbers in brackets in the following text refer to the frame fixing illustration below.
Remove the engine support bracket to crankcase fixings (1).
Remove the right hand outrigger to crankcase upper mounting bolt (6). Collect the expanding sleeve (7) and tapered sleeve (8).
Remove the right hand outrigger to crankcase lower mounting bolt (9). Collect the expanding sleeve (10) and tapered sleeve (11).
Remove the left hand outrigger to crankcase upper mounting bolt (12).
Remove the left hand outrigger to crankcase lower mounting bolt (13) .
Remove the cylinder head left hand rear mounting bolt (4).
Remove the cylinder head right hand rear mounting bolt (5).
Remove the cylinder head left hand front mounting bolt (3). Discard the lock nut.
Remove the cylinder head right hand front mounting bolt (2). Discard the lock nut.
